results.title: The Rhine: background for social studies
results.brief_description: An overall view of the significant influence of the Rhine River throughout Europe. Traces its historical importance, from its role as a frontier of the Roman Empire to its place as a highway of modern commerce. Studies its effect upon the lives and activities of the people who live near it and upon the nations which have fought to control it.

results.title: The Revolving door
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Frank Loveland and Vision Associates
results.brief_description: Examines the administration of justice in the area of minor crime in the United States. Shows the weaknesses of the established systems of lower courts and jails, pointing out that they are inadequate for the volume of offences and fail in rehabilitation. Narrated by Paul Richards.

results.title: The Revolution will not now take place
results.brief_description: Robert Conquest writes and narrates the history of communism from 1917 to 1969, showing that a true Marxist revolution of power to the people has never occurred. A masterly summary of 52 years of political history, this documentary includes a clip from the Halas and Batchelor animated film version of “Animal Farm”, Leon Trotsky reading a speech in English, Leonard Schapiro commenting on Stalin vs Trotsky and archival footage of historical figures such as Lenin, Stalin, Hitler, Churchill, Kruzchev, Fidel Castro, Ho Chi Minh. Stills filmed by Ken Morse.

results.title: The Revealing eye
results.brief_description: Surveys the history of cinematography and microphotography with many examples of the strides that have been taken in these fields. The history of the scientific study of motion through the cine-camera. High-speed, and time-lapse cinematography allied with X-ray and the microscope have made possible the study of movements and subjects which the normal eye cannot see. Experiments from 1890 to 1940, when it was possible to slow down the flight of a bullet so that one is seen tapping a piece of glass and passing through before the glass is shattered. Cinematography from space rockets. The use of colour photography in the schlieren technique.

results.title: The Restless Earth
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), BBC, National Educational Television, Studio Hamburg and Sverides Radio Sweeden
results.brief_description: Looks at the earth’s geological history in terms of the ”plate theory”, with particular reference to Britain. Discusses the movement of the plates carrying the continents, the formation of oceans and mountains, and the occurrence of earthquakes and volcanoes. Introduced by Magnus Magnusson and narrated by John Gregson. (This is the Australian version with Australians - Peter Ross and Keith Michell- as host and narrator).

results.title: The Research director
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Morten Parker and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A description of the work of a research director of a United Steel Workers Union in Canada. The painstaking research and analyses of economic information, and the arrangement of arguments that lie beneath the negotiations of labour unions for better wages and working conditions are shown.

results.title: The Rescuers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Art Stevens, John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Courageous rescues are the speciality of secret agent mice, Bernard and Bianca. An innocent orphan named Penny is kidnapped by Madame Medusa, a wickedly wacky villainess. Madame Medusa needs Penny to recover a priceless jewel. Bernard and Bianca set out to save Penny from Madame Medusa’s evil clutches. Voices are provided by Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor and Geraldine Page. Animated.

results.title: The Rescue
results.creator_credit: Gordon Mackay, Harry Govan and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: How two young climbers get into difficulties and are saved by the joint efforts of a Royal Air Force Mountain Rescue Team and other experienced climbers. Contrasts correct ways of mountain climbing with careless methods. Set in the mountains of Argyll and Inverness.

results.title: The Republic of the Philippines
results.creator_credit: Leo Guelpa Jr, Dudley Pictures and United World Films
results.brief_description: Republic of the Philippines, seen through the eyes of a young Filipino teacher. The geographical background, the native races, the landscape, cultivation of various crops, the development of industries, mineral resources, forest products and hydro-electricity, and the growth of the education and public health systems.

results.title: The Republic of South Africa: the land and its people - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Compares three ways of life in the Republic of South Africa: tribal life, white farmers and mining communities. Shows how the culture patterns of each region are influenced by the topography climate, and resources of the region.
